page.title: 11Wytham Woods
page.content: When interviewed, the Forester said that 1/3rd of Wytham Estate is covered by woodland.All the common trees grow in the woods. One oak tree is 700 years old. The woods are an open-air laboratory for the University: 40 different projects are being developed this year. Animals and plants are studied. The Forester is responsible for preserving and renewing the woods. This is very much a full time occupation. He looks after the trees in the woods, in the village, on the farms, and liaises with the University. Felling and planting are his concern: May to November is his busiest time The village is a conservation area and no trees can be felled without planning permission. Within the woods, in recent years, a saw-mill has been established: 3 of the 5 men employed live in the village
